jobs.description:
The short version:

Early-stage venture-backed startup looking for a software engineer to use Python, Javascript, and HTML/CSS to help build out our web platform. Good fit if you like moving fast, having impact, and working on a variety of different things.

Who we are

We‚Äôre a fast-moving startup with a vision to empower all professionals by helping them build better relationships. Our vision is to fix the network gap: the inequality of opportunity driven by not having the right connections. To solve this problem, we‚Äôre combining the best practices of the world‚Äôs top relationship builders with artificial intelligence.

We‚Äôre building a mission-driven team that strives to live out our values every day:

  • Customer-centricity
  • Diversity of perspective
  • Authenticity
  • Growth (individual and collective)
  • Impact

We‚Äôre an ambitious, driven team and we push ourselves to accomplish a lot quickly. In the past couple of years we‚Äôve gone through one of the world‚Äôs top accelerators, raised two rounds of venture financing, launched our product, rapidly grown our customer base, and architected a robust set of machine learning models as a core source of competitive advantage. In the process, we‚Äôve been named one of Chicago‚Äôs top 19 startups to watch ‚Äì and we plan on giving the world even more to watch in the years to come!

What your role will be

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced full stack engineer to help build the core 4Degrees platform. You‚Äôll build and use a versatile set of skills: switching between tasks like rolling out major new functionality, diagnosing and fixing bugs, and playing support for other front-end or back-end engineers.

You‚Äôll combine a bias to action with a passion for having an impact to deliver new, innovative solutions to our customers. We‚Äôre building an industry-defining company that requires entirely new approaches; you‚Äôll be a core part of that effort and will be comfortable experimenting, learning, and expanding the scope of what‚Äôs possible.

About you

  • Excited about the 4Degrees mission and believes in our core values
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment, and is comfortable with experimentation and risk-taking
  • Driven by the opportunity to create impact, and takes full ownership of achieving personal and team objectives
  • Motivated to explore the potential for technology to augment people‚Äôs ability to form and strengthen professional relationships
  • Challenges existing industry best practices and takes inspiration from disparate sources to build a groundbreaking product
  • Collaborative mindset ‚Äì recognizing that most great outcomes are accomplished by teams, not individuals

Skills you‚Äôll need

  • Proficiency with back-end programming (Python preferred, but we can train you if you‚Äôre good with Ruby, Node, PHP, etc.)
  • Proficiency with front-end programming in vanilla languages (Javascript, HTML, CSS)
  • Comfort with plain SQL and an ORM

We‚Äôd be really excited if you are

  • Experienced with mobile development, particularly using React Native
  • Experienced with the Flask web framework
  • Experienced with machine learning and/or statistical analysis

Benefits

  • Competitive cash+equity compensation based on level of capability
  • Unlimited PTO (min. 2 weeks, avg. 3-4)
  • Unlimited paid sick leave (mandatory for infectuous diseases)
  • Employer group health insurance, subsidized 50% by company
  • Annual professional development stipend
  • Commuter benefits

Want to join us?

Send over a quick note with your resume, links to project examples, and thoughts on why this role is exciting to you to talent@4degrees.ai. Our values are critical to us; in your email, please also talk a bit about how these values resonate with you.

This is an on-site position in Chicago, IL.

The only way we‚Äôll bridge the network gap is if our team represents all of the backgrounds and perspectives of those it impacts. We care deeply about adding people that contribute to our team from across all races, ethnicities, religions, ages, sexual orientations, genders, sexes, countries of origin, and more.

jobs.description:
Pilotly is the first self-service insights platform for media content- we make complex research simple, fast and cost effective. Through our interactive video platform, we are able to collect detailed consumer feedback rapidly from specific target audiences, and then process the data using our A.I. algorithms to surface valuable insights to our clients. We‚Äôre in a unique position to completely change the consumer insights landscape affecting culture around the world, because, after all, the most influential communications leverage video. Help us become the platform of records for every organization, small to large, that needs to optimize the outcome of their video.

Every day we‚Äôre collecting hundreds of thousands of data points from our research studies. Whether it‚Äôs a response to a question, a user interaction with our video experience or an implicit activity we derive insight from, there is always data being collected during a Pilotly experience. While we process this data to surface insights for clients, there is a bigger picture opportunity here. We can look at data across industries to surface market trends, identify new performance indicators that leverage our depth of respondent data and match our 1st party with 3rd party data to produce new valuable insights.

Using your background in math, statistics and computer science, we‚Äôre excited for you to turn our millions of consumer data points into a playground of valuable information for our clients.

Overall Expectation
*As Pilotly continues to grow at an accelerating rate, we need someone who can fully digest the breadth of consumer data that we have and arrange it into a symphony of insights that can both improve our product and help customers. You‚Äôre to be the one who ensures that none of our data is dormant. *

| A Good Baseline to Start from
-Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, or other related field) from an academic institution

-Expert in Python and SQL, as well as experience with MongoDb

-Excellent communication skills with demonstrated success presenting complex data and analysis in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action

-Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques used in market research

-Quick learner, with the ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance

-Preferably experienced with dataset from TV data providers like Nielsen and Comscore

| Your Daily Grind
-Support research services with complex data analysis and validation of certain consumer insight assertions

-Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how users interact with our products

-Keep research norms up to date, using this data to create new and better ways to quickly inform clients of their content‚Äôs overall performance

-Mine Pilotly data to extract actionable insights that inform, influence, support, and help execute our product decisions and launches. While mining data you‚Äôll be working to surface new key metrics that tie tightly to content performance, giving us new ways to provide value to our clients

-Design and implement reporting and metrics that track and monitor the performance of our products, the quality of our data, and overall health of the business

| Why Pilotly
-We‚Äôre always building new media technology that keeps us ahead of the market

-We are affecting culture, so we must be purveyors of culture, our team reflects that. We pride ourselves on keeping the Pilotly team diverse and versatile in thought

-Every day is a different experience when you work with video, one day you‚Äôre talking with the creators of your favorite TV show and the next you‚Äôre meeting an influencer that a brand is creating content around

-Stay creative, everyone on our team does. Work with people who don‚Äôt just geek on out on technology, we have lives outside of the 60 hour weeks

-Health benefits available

-Oh and unlimited paid time off

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Growth Bets
jobs.description:
About the Role

Growth Bets at Uber are 0-to-1 initiatives with potential to scale to the next multi-billion dollar business in the next 3-5 years. We are looking to bring onboard a seasoned & entrepreneurial product manager with demonstrated experience building early-stage consumer products, to join the founding team for one such Growth Bet at UberEats.

This is a global product role based out of Bengaluru, India. In the first year, this role might require occasional international travel (once in 4 months) to the pilot market for user research & feedback post launch.

If you like operating at start-up pace and BigTech scale, then this might be a relevant opportunity. Ex-founders are welcome.

What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points

---- What the Candidate Will Do ----

  1. Define the strategy, scope & success metrics for a product at pre-PMF stage
  2. Partner with UX research, design, data science, engineering & product operations teams to deeply understand user needs, competitive landscape, and to scope, build & iterate products that delight and deliver 10x value to customers.
  3. Collaborate with operations, product marketing, global account management teams to define the GTM / launch strategy and drive execution. Constantly monitor product performance & feedback, learn & iterate.
  4. Clearly communicate product plans, benefits, and results, as appropriate, to a spectrum of audiences, including internal & external partners and leadership teams.

---- Basic Qualifications ----
  1. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Management or equivalent.
  2. 8+ years of experience as a product manager with a track record of partnering with engineering, design, data science and business functions to deliver successful projects at scale.
  3. 3+ years of experience building & iterating on early-stage (0-1 / 1-10) consumer products, that involved extensive customer research and close collaboration with UX/design teams.
  4. Demonstrated experience of independently running user research, defining PMF goals, scoping MVP, building iterative roadmaps and driving cross-functional execution on new initiatives / projects with high ambiguity.

---- Preferred Qualifications ----
  1. Prior entrepreneurial experience in consumer product domain, as a founder or a founding team member
  2. 3+ years experience leading New Initiatives at larger tech organizations
  3. Prior experience working with global teams and/or solving for a global customer base

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuelds progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

*Accommodations may be available based on religious and/or medical conditions, or as required by applicable law. To request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@uber.com.

jobs.description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

The Celonis Supply Chain team is a young team of product enthusiasts that focuses on developing best-in class Business Apps in the domain of Supply Chain. Business Apps are purpose-built solutions created for a specific line of business, addressing most impactful pain points in their respective domain. The apps are best practice examples of how Celonis is used in new, innovative ways that push the boundaries of our platform. The team has a great balance of technical skills to build solutions paired with a customer focus and product management mindset to create meaningful products widely adopted across our customer base.

The Role:

You will gain experience in the Supply Chain and related processes and act as the interface between customers, our Go-To-Market and our Product & Engineering teams, shaping the future of Celonis‚Äô Business Apps in this domain. Take this chance to rethink the way companies run their Supply Chain processes and help our customers to accelerate their value realization with Celonis.

The work you‚Äôll do:

  • Work closely with customers to understand their pain points in Supply Chain with a focus on Production and Production Planning
  • Be involved in all steps within the product development lifecycle from ideation to product development to scaling solutions across all Celonis customers

jobs.description:
About the Role

Uber has grown from "push a button and get a ride" to a way that users can "go anywhere and get anything" in their local city. The Uber One Membership team aims to make interacting with your city, and using all of Uber's services, as convenient and sticky as possible. We've built Uber One members to greater than 20M and counting, but have still only scratched the surface of what a global Membership program could do for Uber. Come build with us!

As the PM for Uber One, you'll be crucial in driving higher engagement and retention of our member base. Your role will focus on optimizing our discounts and pricing structures to add more value to our members. By leveraging data-driven insights and implementing targeted strategies, you'll drive growth and long-term loyalty from members.

This role is a great fit for a PM who is excited to work on leveraging data insights and models to solve optimisation problems.

What the Candidate Will Do

  1. You'll launch features that drive engagement & reduce churn across the UberEats app, Uber Rides app, and out-of-app communication channels.
  2. You will define, own, and execute the product roadmap, working closely with cross-functional counterparts (Engineering, Data Science, Design, Operations, and more)..

Basic Qualifications
  1. Product Experience: 5+ years of product management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them - and you're deeply proud of what you've accomplished.
  2. Leadership Experience: Prior experience setting and delivering on a strategy you crafted, working with multiple cross-functional stakeholders and partners, while being accountable for outcomes.
  3. Data chops: You find a way to get the data you need and whip it into an insightful story with no help. You know how to use this data to make decisions without getting stuck in analysis paralysis.
  4. Technical chops: you have collaborated with engineers in developing the technical architecture of the products you have built, and are comfortable discussing requirement and scope tradeoffs.
  5. Strategic: You can craft a coherent product vision, multi-year strategy, and quarterly roadmap that your team and the business rallies behind.
  6. Business-minded: You are passionate about building businesses, not features. You not only own the user metrics but also own and optimize business performance metrics.

Preferred Qualifications
  1. Experience working on marketplace products and/or ML consumer facing models.
  2. Experience launching products across global markets.

jobs.description:
We help the world Be Everyday Ready√¢¬Ñ¬¢


Today√¢¬Ä¬ôs threatscape is relentless. So are we. At Cyderes, we specialize in building practical IAM, exposure management, and risk programs, and stopping active threats fast with MDR that works with your existing security tools √¢¬Ä¬î all augmented by AI and driven by seasoned operators. Our tireless global team is laser-focused on cybersecurity, arming organizations with the people, platforms, and perspectives they need to conquer whatever tomorrow throws their way.



About the Role:

Cyderes is looking for a dedicated, creative, and experienced Senior DevOps Engineer to join the Managed Services Engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for automating everything, identifying opportunities for optimization/stability, and exploring new ideas to better our services and products. You should have experience working efficiently on small teams, being flexible in filling roles, and a strong understanding of cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP). The position requires experience with CI/CD workflows, scripted automation, metric gathering and analysis, and supportive tooling related to big data operations. Candidates must be able to establish and enforce strong security practices and have a willingness to learn and provide feedback on upcoming technologies. Additionally, this role will be responsible for and help in the creation of our underlying Cyderes platforms, ensure the highest level of quality and stability of the platform, and integrate with developers to get functionality out as fast and stable as possible.

Candidate should also bring the right attitude to the team including accountability, ownership, and positivity. We embrace the fast-paced development field and are looking for like-minded individuals that have a passion for continual improvement, innovative ideas, tinkering with new projects, and taking on complex problems.

\n


Responsibilities:
  • Run, maintain, and improve the Cyderes managed cloud environments
  • Help lead initiatives for improving system reliability
  • Troubleshoot and remediate any system/automation issues
  • Maintain and support production Kubernetes environments
  • Mentor other DevOps Engineers to improve team efficiencies and help to solve complex problems
  • Work with Engineering Leadership to keep projects and deliverables on track
  • Take part in both internal and external user outreach
  • Collaborate with internal teams to improve CI/CD processes and procedures
  • Regularly take part in architecture and roadmap meetings with leadership
  • Document and standardize engineering procedures
  • Creation and maintenance of automation (tooling/scripting) to assist in the deployment and ongoing support of Cyderes cloud-managed infrastructure
  • Contribute towards MVPs/PoCs for proposed tooling and management solutions
  • Participate in all team scrum ceremonies
  • Participate in technical discussions and work with the team to design robust, secure, monitored, and well-maintained systems
  • Support a 24x7 team on-call rotation for production / infrastructure incidents
  • Engage in code review to ensure high-quality code standards and foster knowledge sharing
  • Apply best practices in cybersecurity to safeguard Cyderes applications from potential threats and vulnerabilities, remediating concerns across our cloud platforms


Requirements:
  • Minimum of 5 years in Development/SE/SRE/DevOps
  • Proficiency in investigative analysis of CI/CD pipelines and backend systems
  • Practical knowledge of containerization and orchestration, specifically Kubernetes and Docker and related tools (helm, kubectl).
  • Expertise in state configuration (Terraform, Salt, Ansible, Puppet, Chef) knowledge
  • Proficient in cloud environments including AWS, Azure, and GCP
  • Experience with Git and CI/CD tools such as GitHub, GitHub Actions
  • Understands best practices throughout the SDLC, encompassing code standards, PR reviews, build processes, testing and deployments
  • Upholds core values of accountability, integrity, empathy, and responsiveness
  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Capability to collaborate effectively, even in challenging scenarios
  • Practiced in agile methodologies, particularly scrum
  • Demonstrated skills in delivering high quality code that is maintainable and readable
  • Bachelor√¢¬Ä¬ôs degree in Computer Science, Information Security or related field
  • Strong knowledge of database technologies (Postgres SQL, MySql)
  • 9+ years working in the Development/SE/SRE/DevOps fields
  • Experience with virtualization hypervisors (VMWare, Microsoft Hyper-V, XenServer)
  • Source control and CI/CD (ArgoCD, Jenkins, GitHub, Spinnaker, Concourse CI, etc.) knowledge
  • Acquainted with observability platforms such as Grafana, Prometheus, or Datadog.


\n

Cyderes is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, national origin, or veteran status.


Note: This job posting is intended for direct applicants only. We request that outside recruiters do not contact us regarding this position.

jobs.description:

Ryz Labs is looking for a Mid-level / Senior Full Stack Engineer to join our client's small, fast-moving team, and help shape the next chapter of their platform. You√¢¬Ä¬ôll work across the stack, contributing to key technical decisions, building new features, and helping strengthen the foundation of a scalable, modern engineering culture. This role is perfect for an experienced engineer who loves hands-on development, thrives in startup environments, and wants to make an outsized impact on a mission-driven product.


Key Responsibilities:


- Design and ship features across the stack (frontend + backend) to deliver high-impact functionality quickly.

- Build integrations and workflows, developing APIs, data flows, and partner integrations that extend our client's ecosystem.

- Balance scrappy with scalable, leveraging no or low-code solutions where they accelerate delivery and investing in solid architecture where it matters most.

- Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and collaborative problem-solving.

- Help improve engineering processes and documentation as the team and product evolve.

- Prepare for growth by ensuring systems and processes meet investor diligence standards as the company approaches Series A.

 

Qualifications:


- 3+ years of full-stack engineering experience with expertise in both frontend and backend development.

- Frontend experience with React and JavaScript/TypeScript, including client-side integrations such as iframe-based embeds and Webflow.

- Backend experience with Python (FastAPI), Node.js microservices, REST APIs, and PostgreSQL.

- Strong foundation in data modeling, performance optimization, and data integrity.

- Proven ability to connect systems including APIs, AI and ML APIs, webhooks, data flows, and analytics tools such as Google Analytics 4.

GoodLeap is also proud to support our award-winning nonprofit, GivePower, which is building and deploying life-saving water and clean electricity systems, changing the lives of more than 1.6 million people across Africa, Asia, and South America.
